Key Match Events: The Knicks were held to their lowest point total of the season
The Magic limited the Knicks to 4-for-22 shooting from 3-point range
Pre-Game Insights: The Knicks were missing Karl-Anthony Towns due to right knee pain
The Magic were missing their top four scorers because of injuries
Post-Match Reflections: The Magic shut down the Knicks team with a 103-94 victory
The Knicks suffered their season-high third straight loss
Miscellaneous Highlights: Wendell Carter Jr. had a season-high 19 points off the bench
The Magic outscored the Knicks 50-18 in bench points
The Magic came in with no healthy players averaging double figures
Others: The Magic avoided a four-game sweep by winning the final meeting, keeping the lead in the all-time series at 68-66
